result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiger A.F. Glynn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tiger A.F. Glynn
Current: 525 Fremont Street, Algoma, WI 54201 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2016)
Prior: 9685 School Rd, Brussels, WI 54204

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss case but read in for sentencing in case no. 16-CM-80. Court dismisses but will read case in for sentencing in case no. 16-CM-80.

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges in new case 16CM115. Defense will have to do conflict check on that file.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, previous activity. Defense is trying to work out global resolution, requests 30-45 days. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests status in about 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, charges. Defense enters not guilty pleas, requests status to allow time to get up to speed. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Amended Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews previous activity. Defendant just lost his job, cannot be represented by PD until he receives note from Harbor Village that he's unemployed. Court questions how Defendant lost job. Defendant was going to have to find new place to live, didn't go to work, has called boss asking for note that his employment has been terminated.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.
No contact direct or indirect with WF. No violent contact direct or indirect with TT.

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD, wants Court-appointed Counsel. Petition given to Defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
